page.title: 06HOME LIFE
page.content: With no shops in the area all families have to do their shopping elsewhere. There are limited shopping facilities in Botesdale, Redgrave and Hopton, with each of these villages having at least one grocer's shop and a Post Office. However many families travel to Diss or Bury St. Edmunds for most supplies, and for some items to Norwich, Ipswich or Cambridge. Many families travel to town to buy the bulk of their groceries and only use more local shops to 'top up' individual items they forget while in town, or if they need it urgently.Many families grow a proportion of their vegetable requirements in their garden. Most households have pets with a large proportion having at least one dog; and several keeping a pony.
